I've unfortunately hit a bit of a snag on IVA production:

So, on the IVA here, outside the window you will see a bit of "clipping" polygons.

What those polygons are are actually the outside mesh's window "frame" trough.

Now, these shouldn't be visible? Because:

  • The IVA mesh is literally just an invert of the exterior mesh, the windows in the exact same place.
  • The position in Unity is the same.

Have I gone horrible wrong somewhere, or is this a known thing in KSP and is there a workaround?

Thank you very much for any help with this!
Try to scale it up by 1.25x and see if it fits. That damn 1.25x rescaling can be unintuitive sometimes.
When making IVAs and props, I generally avoid scaling altogether and model at 1:1 scale.
